element.short: 保険会社はラインアイテムを追加しました / Insurer added line items
element.definition: 支払人の追加製品またはサービスラインのための第一層のサービス裁定。 / The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.
element.requirements: 保険会社は、提供された製品またはサービスを再定義するか、製品とサービスのグループをパッケージ化および/または分解することができます。ADDITEMSにより、保険会社は、提出されたアイテム/詳細/サブデテールへのリンクをラインアイテムリストに提供できます。事前承認では、保険会社はadditem構造を使用して、認定された製品とサービスに関する追加情報を提供する場合があります。 / Insurers may redefine the provided product or service or may package and/or decompose groups of products and services. The addItems allows the insurer to provide their line item list with linkage to the submitted items/details/sub-details. In a preauthorization the insurer may use the addItem structure to provide additional information on authorized products and services.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 要素間参照のための一意のID / Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: リソース内の要素の一意のID（内部参照用）。これは、スペースを含まない文字列値である場合があります。 / Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: 実装で定義された追加のコンテンツ / Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: 要素の基本的な定義の一部ではない追加情報を表すために使用できます。拡張機能を安全で管理しやすくするために、拡張機能の定義と使用に適用される厳格なガバナンスセットがあります。実装者は拡張機能を定義できますが、拡張機能の定義の一部として満たされる一連の要件があります。 / May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: 拡張機能を使用または定義する機関や管轄権に関係なく、アプリケーション、プロジェクト、または標準による拡張機能の使用に関連するスティグマはありません。拡張機能の使用は、FHIR仕様がすべての人にコアレベルのシンプルさを保持できるようにするものです。 / There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
両方ではなく、拡張または値[x]が必要です / Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: 認識されていなくても無視できない拡張機能 / Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
要素の基本的な定義の一部ではなく、それが含まれている要素の理解、および/または含まれる要素の子孫の理解を変更するために使用される場合があります。通常、修飾子要素は否定または資格を提供します。拡張機能を安全で管理しやすくするために、拡張機能の定義と使用に適用される厳格なガバナンスセットがあります。実装者は拡張機能を定義できますが、拡張機能の定義の一部として満たされる一連の要件があります。アプリケーションの処理リソースは、修飾子拡張機能をチェックする必要があります。

モディファイア拡張は、リソースまたはdomainResource上の要素の意味を変更してはなりません（修飾軸自体の意味を変更することはできません）。 / May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: 拡張機能を使用または定義する機関や管轄権に関係なく、アプリケーション、プロジェクト、または標準による拡張機能の使用に関連するスティグマはありません。拡張機能の使用は、FHIR仕様がすべての人にコアレベルのシンプルさを保持できるようにするものです。 / There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: 修飾子拡張機能により、安全に無視できる大部分の拡張機能と明確に区別できるように、安全に無視できない拡張機能が可能になります。これにより、実装者が拡張の存在を禁止する必要性を排除することにより、相互運用性が促進されます。詳細については、[修飾子拡張の定義]（拡張性.html＃modifierextension）を参照してください。 / Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
両方ではなく、拡張または値[x]が必要です / Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: 修飾子拡張は、それらを含む要素の意味または解釈を変更することが期待されています / Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: アイテムシーケンス番号 / Item sequence number
element.definition: このサービスラインが交換することを目的とした項目を請求します。 / Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.
element.requirements: クレーム項目への参照を提供します。 / Provides references to the claim items.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 詳細シーケンス番号 / Detail sequence number
element.definition: この行が交換することを意図したクレーム項目内の詳細のシーケンス番号。 / The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.
element.requirements: クレームアイテム内のクレームの詳細への参照を提供します。 / Provides references to the claim details within the claim item.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: サブデテールシーケンス番号 / Subdetail sequence number
element.definition: サブデテールのシーケンス番号は、この行が置き換えることを意図したクレーム項目内の詳細を防ぎます。 / The sequence number of the sub-details woithin the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.
element.requirements: クレームの詳細内のクレームサブデテールへの参照を提供します。 / Provides references to the claim sub-details within the claim detail.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 認定プロバイダー / Authorized providers
element.definition: 患者に提供されるサービスの許可されているプロバイダー。 / The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.
element.requirements: 保険会社は、公開許可ではなく、特に制限付きのプロバイダーに承認を提供する場合があります。 / Insurer may provide authorization specifically to a restricted set of providers rather than an open authorization.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 請求、サービス、製品、または薬物コード / Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: 値がグループコードの場合、このアイテムは関連する請求の詳細のセットを収集します。そうしないと、これには製品、サービス、薬物、またはアイテムのその他の請求コードが含まれています。 / When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: これが実際のサービスまたは製品ライン、つまりグループではない場合は、コードを使用して、提供されたプロフェッショナルサービスまたは製品（CTP、HCPCS、USCLS、ICD10、NCPDP、DIN、RXNORM、ACHI、CCI）を示します。グループ化アイテムがグループコードを使用して、グループ化されているもののタイプを示す。「メガネ」または「化合物」。 / If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.
element.requirements: 提供または行われたことを述べるために必要です。 / Necessary to state what was provided or done.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 許容サービスと製品コード。 / Allowable service and product codes.

element.short: サービス/製品請求修飾子 / Service/Product billing modifiers
element.definition: アイテムの典型的または修飾子コードは、製品またはサービスの追加コンテキストを伝えます。 / Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: たとえば、治療が化粧品であるか、TMJに関連しているか、または治療が診療所の外にあったのか在留時間がないかどうかの経口で。 / For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.
element.requirements: 裁定のためにアイテムの含有をサポートしたり、料金の引き上げを請求したりするため。 / To support inclusion of the item for adjudication or to charge an elevated fee.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: アイテムの種類または修飾子コード、例えば、治療が化粧品であるか、TMJに関連するか、またはアプライアンスが紛失または盗難されたかどうか。 / Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.short: プログラム製品またはサービスが提供されています / Program the product or service is provided under
element.definition: これが回復される可能性のあるプログラムを特定します。 / Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
element.comment: 例：新生児プログラム、児童歯科プログラム、または薬物使用者の回復プログラム。 / For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.
element.requirements: 人口セグメントまたは疾患分類に焦点を当てた公開されたプログラムの特定で一般的に使用されています。 / Commonly used in in the identification of publicly provided program focused on population segments or disease classifications.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: プログラム固有の理由コード。 / Program specific reason codes.

element.short: サービスの日付または日付または製品配達 / Date or dates of service or product delivery
element.definition: サービスまたは製品が提供、実行、または完了した日付または日付。 / The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.
element.requirements: 保険の補償期間中にサービスまたは製品が提供されたかどうかを判断する必要がありました。 / Needed to determine whether the  service or product was provided during the term of the insurance coverage.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: サービスの場所または製品が供給された場所 / Place of service or where product was supplied
element.definition: 製品またはサービスが提供された場所。 / Where the product or service was provided.
element.requirements: 場所は、アイテムが保険目的で受け入れられるかどうかを変更するか、給付金額の決定に影響を与えるかを変更することができます。 / The location can alter whether the item was acceptable for insurance purposes or impact the determination of the benefit amount.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: サービスがレンダリングされる場所。 / Place where the service is rendered.

element.short: 製品またはサービスのカウント / Count of products or services
element.definition: サービスまたは製品の繰り返しの数。 / The number of repetitions of a service or product.
element.requirements: 製品またはサービスコードが提供された数量を伝えない場合に必要です。 / Required when the product or service code does not convey the quantity provided.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: アイテムあたりの料金、料金、またはコスト / Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: アイテムがグループではない場合、これは製品またはサービスの料金です。そうでなければ、これはグループの詳細の合計料金です。 / If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.
element.requirements: 単一のユニットのプロバイダーによって患者に請求された金額。 / The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 価格スケーリングファクター / Price scaling factor
element.definition: 配信されたサービスおよび/または受け取った商品の全体的な価値を決定する際に使用される乗数を表す実数。要因の概念により、割引または追加料金乗数を金額に適用できます。 / A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: 10％のシニアの割引を示すために、入力された値は0.90（1.00-0.10）です。 / To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).
element.requirements: 患者に割引が提供される場合（例：シニアの割引）、これは裁定のために文書化する必要があります。 / When discounts are provided to a patient (example: Senior's discount) then this must be documented for adjudication.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 総アイテムコスト / Total item cost
element.definition: 数量は、追加のサービスまたは製品または請求の単価の時間倍です。 / The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: たとえば、式：数量 * unitprice * factor = net。量と因子は、供給されない場合は1であると想定されます。 / For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: グループ（ハタの場合）またはラインアイテムに請求される合計量を提供します。 / Provides the total amount claimed  for the group (if a grouper) or the line item.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 解剖学的場所 / Anatomical location
element.definition: 患者の物理的なサービスサイト（手足、歯など）。 / Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
element.comment: たとえば、歯のコードを提供することで、保険会社は、以前に削除された歯の詰め物を実行するプロバイダーを特定できます。 / For example, providing a tooth code allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.
element.requirements: 保険会社が特定の手順を検証できるようにします。 / Allows insurer to validate specific procedures.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 歯のコード、象限、六重量、弓。 / The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.short: 解剖学的サブロケーション / Anatomical sub-location
element.definition: ボディサイトの領域または表面、例えば四肢領域または歯の表面。 / A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).
element.requirements: 保険会社が特定の手順を検証できるようにします。 / Allows insurer to validate specific procedures.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 歯の表面と表面の組み合わせのコード。 / The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.short: 該当するメモ番号 / Applicable note numbers
element.definition: このアイテムの裁定に適用されるメモに関連付けられた数字。 / The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
element.requirements: ラインアイテムの裁定について、人間の読みやすい記述的説明を関連付けるための凝縮された方法を提供します。 / Provides a condensed manner for associating human readable descriptive explanations for adjudications on the line item.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 追加されたアイテムの裁定 / Added items adjudication
element.definition: 裁定の結果。 / The adjudication results.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: 支払人追加サービスの第2層サービス裁定。 / The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.short: 請求、サービス、製品、または薬物コード / Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: 値がグループコードの場合、このアイテムは関連する請求の詳細のセットを収集します。そうしないと、これには製品、サービス、薬物、またはアイテムのその他の請求コードが含まれています。 / When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: これが実際のサービスまたは製品ライン、つまりグループではない場合は、コードを使用して、提供されたプロフェッショナルサービスまたは製品（CTP、HCPCS、USCLS、ICD10、NCPDP、DIN、RXNORM、ACHI、CCI）を示します。グループ化アイテムがグループコードを使用して、グループ化されているもののタイプを示す。「メガネ」または「化合物」。 / If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.
element.requirements: 提供または行われたことを述べるために必要です。 / Necessary to state what was provided or done.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 許容サービスと製品コード。 / Allowable service and product codes.

element.short: サービス/製品請求修飾子 / Service/Product billing modifiers
element.definition: アイテムの典型的または修飾子コードは、製品またはサービスの追加コンテキストを伝えます。 / Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: たとえば、治療が化粧品であるか、TMJに関連しているか、または治療が診療所の外にあったのか在留時間がないかどうかの経口で。 / For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.
element.requirements: 裁定のためにアイテムの含有をサポートしたり、料金の引き上げを請求したりするため。 / To support inclusion of the item for adjudication or to charge an elevated fee.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: アイテムの種類または修飾子コード、例えば、治療が化粧品であるか、TMJに関連するか、またはアプライアンスが紛失または盗難されたかどうか。 / Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.short: 製品またはサービスのカウント / Count of products or services
element.definition: サービスまたは製品の繰り返しの数。 / The number of repetitions of a service or product.
element.requirements: 製品またはサービスコードが提供された数量を伝えない場合に必要です。 / Required when the product or service code does not convey the quantity provided.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: アイテムあたりの料金、料金、またはコスト / Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: アイテムがグループではない場合、これは製品またはサービスの料金です。そうでなければ、これはグループの詳細の合計料金です。 / If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.
element.requirements: 単一のユニットのプロバイダーによって患者に請求された金額。 / The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 価格スケーリングファクター / Price scaling factor
element.definition: 配信されたサービスおよび/または受け取った商品の全体的な価値を決定する際に使用される乗数を表す実数。要因の概念により、割引または追加料金乗数を金額に適用できます。 / A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: 10％のシニアの割引を示すために、入力された値は0.90（1.00-0.10）です。 / To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).
element.requirements: 患者に割引が提供される場合（例：シニアの割引）、これは裁定のために文書化する必要があります。 / When discounts are provided to a patient (example: Senior's discount) then this must be documented for adjudication.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 総アイテムコスト / Total item cost
element.definition: 数量は、追加のサービスまたは製品または請求の単価の時間倍です。 / The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: たとえば、式：数量 * unitprice * factor = net。量と因子は、供給されない場合は1であると想定されます。 / For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: グループ（ハタの場合）またはラインアイテムに請求される合計量を提供します。 / Provides the total amount claimed  for the group (if a grouper) or the line item.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 該当するメモ番号 / Applicable note numbers
element.definition: このアイテムの裁定に適用されるメモに関連付けられた数字。 / The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
element.requirements: ラインアイテムの裁定について、人間の読みやすい記述的説明を関連付けるための凝縮された方法を提供します。 / Provides a condensed manner for associating human readable descriptive explanations for adjudications on the line item.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 追加されたアイテムの裁定 / Added items adjudication
element.definition: 裁定の結果。 / The adjudication results.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 保険会社はラインアイテムを追加しました / Insurer added line items
element.definition: 支払人追加サービスの第3層サービス裁定。 / The third-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 要素間参照のための一意のID / Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: リソース内の要素の一意のID（内部参照用）。これは、スペースを含まない文字列値である場合があります。 / Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: 実装で定義された追加のコンテンツ / Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: 要素の基本的な定義の一部ではない追加情報を表すために使用できます。拡張機能を安全で管理しやすくするために、拡張機能の定義と使用に適用される厳格なガバナンスセットがあります。実装者は拡張機能を定義できますが、拡張機能の定義の一部として満たされる一連の要件があります。 / May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: 拡張機能を使用または定義する機関や管轄権に関係なく、アプリケーション、プロジェクト、または標準による拡張機能の使用に関連するスティグマはありません。拡張機能の使用は、FHIR仕様がすべての人にコアレベルのシンプルさを保持できるようにするものです。 / There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

両方ではなく、拡張または値[x]が必要です / Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: 認識されていなくても無視できない拡張機能 / Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
要素の基本的な定義の一部ではなく、それが含まれている要素の理解、および/または含まれる要素の子孫の理解を変更するために使用される場合があります。通常、修飾子要素は否定または資格を提供します。拡張機能を安全で管理しやすくするために、拡張機能の定義と使用に適用される厳格なガバナンスセットがあります。実装者は拡張機能を定義できますが、拡張機能の定義の一部として満たされる一連の要件があります。アプリケーションの処理リソースは、修飾子拡張機能をチェックする必要があります。

モディファイア拡張は、リソースまたはdomainResource上の要素の意味を変更してはなりません（修飾軸自体の意味を変更することはできません）。 / May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: 拡張機能を使用または定義する機関や管轄権に関係なく、アプリケーション、プロジェクト、または標準による拡張機能の使用に関連するスティグマはありません。拡張機能の使用は、FHIR仕様がすべての人にコアレベルのシンプルさを保持できるようにするものです。 / There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: 修飾子拡張機能により、安全に無視できる大部分の拡張機能と明確に区別できるように、安全に無視できない拡張機能が可能になります。これにより、実装者が拡張の存在を禁止する必要性を排除することにより、相互運用性が促進されます。詳細については、[修飾子拡張の定義]（拡張性.html＃modifierextension）を参照してください。 / Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.requirements: 修飾子拡張機能により、安全に無視できる大部分の拡張機能と明確に区別できるように、安全に無視できない拡張機能が可能になります。これにより、実装者が拡張の存在を禁止する必要性を排除することにより、相互運用性が促進されます。詳細については、[修飾子拡張の定義]（拡張性.html＃modifierextension）を参照してください。 / Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.short: 裁定情報の種類 / Type of adjudication information
element.definition: この裁定レコードの情報タイプを示すコード。情報タイプには、提出された値、プランに基づいて許可または支払われる最大値または割合、患者がこのアイテムに合計または関連する責任者が責任を負う金額、他の補償額によって支払われる金額、およびこの項目の支払可能な利益が含まれます。 / A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: たとえば、コードを示すコード：共同支払い、控除可能、適格、利益、税など。 / For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.
element.requirements: 提供される合計の種類を伝えるために必要です。 / Needed to convey the type of total provided.

element.requirements: 総金額を伝えるために必要です。 / Needed to convey the total monetary amount.

binding.description: 支払いのタイプ（部分、完全）。 / The type (partial, complete) of the payment.

element.short: 非請求問題の支払い調整 / Payment adjustment for non-claim issues
element.definition: この取引に含まれるこの支払いのすべての調整の総額は、この請求の裁定に関連していません。 / Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.
element.comment: 保険会社は、プロバイダーに支払いが行われたときのプロバイダー（給付金）による金額から、以前の過払いなどのプロバイダー（調整）からの金額を差し引きます。 / Insurers will deduct amounts owing from the provider (adjustment), such as a prior overpayment, from the amount owing to the provider (benefits payable) when payment is made to the provider.
element.requirements: 支払いに適用される調整の要求者に助言する。 / To advise the requestor of adjustments applied to the payment.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 支払い調整理由コード。 / Payment Adjustment reason codes.

element.definition:
要素の基本的な定義の一部ではなく、それが含まれている要素の理解、および/または含まれる要素の子孫の理解を変更するために使用される場合があります。通常、修飾子要素は否定または資格を提供します。拡張機能を安全で管理しやすくするために、拡張機能の定義と使用に適用される厳格なガバナンスセットがあります。実装者は拡張機能を定義できますが、拡張機能の定義の一部として満たされる一連の要件があります。アプリケーションの処理リソースは、修飾子拡張機能をチェックする必要があります。

モディファイア拡張は、リソースまたはdomainResource上の要素の意味を変更してはなりません（修飾軸自体の意味を変更することはできません）。 / May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: 拡張機能を使用または定義する機関や管轄権に関係なく、アプリケーション、プロジェクト、または標準による拡張機能の使用に関連するスティグマはありません。拡張機能の使用は、FHIR仕様がすべての人にコアレベルのシンプルさを保持できるようにするものです。 / There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: 修飾子拡張機能により、安全に無視できる大部分の拡張機能と明確に区別できるように、安全に無視できない拡張機能が可能になります。これにより、実装者が拡張の存在を禁止する必要性を排除することにより、相互運用性が促進されます。詳細については、[修飾子拡張の定義]（拡張性.html＃modifierextension）を参照してください。 / Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
両方ではなく、拡張または値[x]が必要です / Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: 修飾子拡張は、それらを含む要素の意味または解釈を変更することが期待されています / Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: 特典分類 / Benefit classification
element.definition: 製品とサービスが提供される一般的なタイプの利点を特定するためのコード。 / Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: 例には、医療、歯周病、腎透析、視力補償が含まれます。 / Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.
element.requirements: 適格性が求められているサービスまたは製品のカテゴリを伝えるために必要です。 / Needed to convey the category of service or product for which eligibility is sought.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 経口、医療、視覚、口腔底などの福利厚生カテゴリ。 / Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

element.short: 計画から除外 / Excluded from the plan
element.definition: 指定されたサービスのクラスがプランから除外されている場合、欠落またはfalseは製品またはサービスがカバレッジに含まれていることを示します。 / True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.
element.requirements: カバレッジから特に除外されたアイテムを識別する必要がありました。 / Needed to identify items that are specifically excluded from the coverage.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 利益のための短い名前 / Short name for the benefit
element.definition: 利益のための短い名前またはタグ。 / A short name or tag for the benefit.
element.comment: 例：MED01、またはDent2。 / For example: MED01, or DENT2.
element.requirements: 他のプラン名と一致する必要があります。 / Required to align with other plan names.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 対象となる利益またはサービスの説明 / Description of the benefit or services covered
element.definition: 対象となる利益またはサービスのより豊かな説明。 / A richer description of the benefit or services covered.
element.comment: たとえば、「DENT2は基本の100％、主要な50％をカバーしていますが、オルソ、インプラント、化粧品サービスを除外しています」。 / For example, 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but excludes Ortho, Implants and Cosmetic services'.
element.requirements: 人間の読み取り可能な参照に必要です。 / Needed for human readable reference.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: ネットワーク内外 / In or out of network
element.definition: 利点がネットワーク内プロバイダーまたはネットワーク外プロバイダーを指すかどうかを示すフラグです。 / Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.
element.requirements: ネットワークプロバイダー内外で必要なのは、カバレッジの下で異なる扱いを受けます。 / Needed as in or out of network providers are treated differently under the coverage.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: ネットワークサービスの内外で分類するコード。 / Code to classify in or out of network services.

element.short: 個人または家族 / Individual or family
element.definition: 利益が個人または家族に当てはまるかどうかを示します。 / Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.
element.requirements: 利益を理解するために必要です。 / Needed for the understanding of the benefits.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: ユニットカバー/サービス - 個人または家族。 / Unit covered/serviced - individual or family.

element.short: 年間または生涯 / Annual or lifetime
element.definition: 「最大生涯給付」や「最大年間訪問」などの値の用語または期間。 / The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.
element.requirements: 利益を理解するために必要です。 / Needed for the understanding of the benefits.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: カバレッジユニット - 年間、生涯。 / Coverage unit - annual, lifetime.

element.short: 特典の概要 / Benefit Summary
element.definition: これまでに使用される利点。 / Benefits Used to date.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 要素間参照のための一意のID / Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: リソース内の要素の一意のID（内部参照用）。これは、スペースを含まない文字列値である場合があります。 / Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: 実装で定義された追加のコンテンツ / Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: 要素の基本的な定義の一部ではない追加情報を表すために使用できます。拡張機能を安全で管理しやすくするために、拡張機能の定義と使用に適用される厳格なガバナンスセットがあります。実装者は拡張機能を定義できますが、拡張機能の定義の一部として満たされる一連の要件があります。 / May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.short: 特典分類 / Benefit classification
element.definition: 提供されている利益の分類。 / Classification of benefit being provided.
element.comment: 例：控除可能、訪問、給付金額。 / For example: deductible, visits, benefit amount.
element.requirements: 利益の性質を伝える必要がありました。 / Needed to convey the nature of the benefit.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: 控除可能、訪問、自己負担など。 / Deductable, visits, co-pay, etc.

element.short: 許可された利点 / Benefits allowed
element.definition: カバレッジの下で許可されている利益の量。 / The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.
element.requirements: カバレッジの下で提供される利益を伝える必要がありました。 / Needed to convey the benefits offered under the coverage.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 使用される利点 / Benefits used
element.definition: これまでに消費された利益の量。 / The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.
element.requirements: これまでに消費された利益を伝えるために必要でした。 / Needed to convey the benefits consumed to date.

constraint.human: すべてのFHIR要素には、@valueまたは子供が必要です / All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Explanation of Benefit resource
element.definition: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

element.short: Business Identifier for the resource
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this explanation of benefit.
element.requirements: Allows EOBs to be distinguished and referenced.

element.short: active | cancelled | draft | entered-in-error
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.
element.requirements: Need to track the status of the resource as 'draft' resources may undergo further edits while 'active' resources are immutable and may only have their status changed to 'cancelled'.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.short: Category or discipline
element.definition: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.
element.comment: The majority of jurisdictions use: oral, pharmacy, vision, professional and institutional, or variants on those terms, as the general styles of claims. The valueset is extensible to accommodate other jurisdictional requirements.
element.requirements: Claim type determine the general sets of business rules applied for information requirements and adjudication.

binding.description: The type or discipline-style of the claim.

element.short: More granular claim type
element.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes such as the US UB-04 bill type code.
element.requirements: Some jurisdictions need a finer grained claim type for routing and adjudication.

binding.description: A more granular claim typecode.

element.short: claim | preauthorization | predetermination
element.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.
element.requirements: This element is required to understand the nature of the request for adjudication.

binding.description: Complete, proposed, exploratory, other.

element.short: The recipient of the products and services
element.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for forecast reimbursement is sought.
element.requirements: The patient must be supplied to the insurer so that confirmation of coverage and service history may be considered as part of the authorization and/or adjudiction.

element.short: Relevant time frame for the claim
element.definition: The period for which charges are being submitted.
element.comment: Typically this would be today or in the past for a claim, and today or in the future for preauthorizations and prodeterminations. Typically line item dates of service should fall within the billing period if one is specified.
element.requirements: A number jurisdictions required the submission of the billing period when submitting claims for example for hospital stays or long-term care.

element.short: Response creation date
element.definition: The date this resource was created.
element.comment: This field is independent of the date of creation of the resource as it may reflect the creation date of a source document prior to digitization. Typically for claims all services must be completed as of this date.
element.requirements: Need to record a timestamp for use by both the recipient and the issuer.

element.short: Author of the claim
element.definition: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
element.requirements: Some jurisdictions require the contact information for personnel completing claims.

element.short: Party responsible for reimbursement
element.definition: The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.
element.requirements: To be a valid claim, preauthorization or predetermination there must be a party who is responsible for adjudicating the contents against a policy which provides benefits for the patient.

element.short: Party responsible for the claim
element.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
element.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

element.short: Desired processing urgency
element.definition: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, routine deferred.
element.comment: If a claim processor is unable to complete the processing as per the priority then they should generate and error and not process the request.
element.requirements: The provider may need to indicate their processing requirements so that the processor can indicate if they are unable to comply.

binding.description: The timeliness with which processing is required: stat, normal, deferred.

element.short: For whom to reserve funds
element.definition: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.
element.comment: This field is only used for preauthorizations.
element.requirements: In the case of a Pre-Determination/Pre-Authorization the provider may request that funds in the amount of the expected Benefit be reserved ('Patient' or 'Provider') to pay for the Benefits determined on the subsequent claim(s). 'None' explicitly indicates no funds reserving is requested.

binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.short: Funds reserved status
element.definition: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.
element.comment: Fund would be release by a future claim quoting the preAuthRef of this response. Examples of values include: provider, patient, none.
element.requirements: Needed to advise the submitting provider on whether the rquest for reservation of funds has been honored.

binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.short: Prior or corollary claims
element.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.
element.comment: For example,  for the original treatment and follow-up exams.
element.requirements: For workplace or other accidents it is common to relate separate claims arising from the same event.

element.short: Reference to the related claim
element.definition: Reference to a related claim.
element.requirements: For workplace or other accidents it is common to relate separate claims arising from the same event.

element.short: How the reference claim is related
element.definition: A code to convey how the claims are related.
element.comment: For example, prior claim or umbrella.
element.requirements: Some insurers need a declaration of the type of relationship.

binding.description: Relationship of this claim to a related Claim.

element.short: File or case reference
element.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.
element.comment: For example, Property/Casualty insurer claim number or Workers Compensation case number.
element.requirements: In cases where an event-triggered claim is being submitted to an insurer which requires a reference number to be specified on all exchanges.

element.short: Prescription authorizing services or products
element.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.
element.requirements: Required to authorize the dispensing of controlled substances and devices.

element.short: Original prescription if superceded by fulfiller
element.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.
element.comment: For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new prescription for an alternate medication which has the same therapeutic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.
element.requirements: Often required when a fulfiller varies what is fulfilled from that authorized on the original prescription.

element.short: Recipient of benefits payable
element.definition: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.
element.comment: Often providers agree to receive the benefits payable to reduce the near-term costs to the patient. The insurer may decline to pay the provider and may choose to pay the subscriber instead.
element.requirements: The provider needs to specify who they wish to be reimbursed and the claims processor needs express who they will reimburse.

element.short: Category of recipient
element.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.
element.requirements: Need to know who should receive payment with the most common situations being the Provider (assignment of benefits) or the Subscriber.

binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

element.short: Recipient reference
element.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.
element.comment: Not required if the payee is 'subscriber' or 'provider'.
element.requirements: Need to provide demographics if the payee is not 'subscriber' nor 'provider'.

element.short: Treatment Referral
element.definition: A reference to a referral resource.
element.comment: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.
element.requirements: Some insurers require proof of referral to pay for services or to pay specialist rates for services.

element.short: Servicing Facility
element.definition: Facility where the services were provided.
element.requirements: Insurance adjudication can be dependant on where services were delivered.

element.short: Claim reference
element.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication request: claim predetermination or preauthorization.
element.requirements: To provide a link to the original adjudication request.

element.short: Claim response reference
element.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication response: claim, predetermination or preauthorization response.
element.requirements: To provide a link to the original adjudication response.

element.short: queued | complete | error | partial
element.definition: The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.
element.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).
element.requirements: To advise the requestor of an overall processing outcome.

binding.description: The result of the claim processing.

element.short: Disposition Message
element.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.
element.requirements: Provided for user display.

element.short: Preauthorization reference
element.definition: Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.
element.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.
element.requirements: On subsequent claims, the insurer may require the provider to quote this value.

element.short: Preauthorization in-effect period
element.definition: The timeframe during which the supplied preauthorization reference may be quoted on claims to obtain the adjudication as provided.
element.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.
element.requirements: On subsequent claims, the insurer may require the provider to quote this value.

element.short: Care Team members
element.definition: The members of the team who provided the products and services.
element.requirements: Common to identify the responsible and supporting practitioners.

element.short: Order of care team
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.
element.requirements: Necessary to maintain the order of the care team and provide a mechanism to link individuals to claim details.

element.short: Practitioner or organization
element.definition: Member of the team who provided the product or service.
element.requirements: Often a regulatory requirement to specify the responsible provider.

element.short: Indicator of the lead practitioner
element.definition: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.
element.comment: Responsible might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.
element.requirements: When multiple parties are present it is required to distinguish the lead or responsible individual.

element.short: Function within the team
element.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.
element.comment: Role might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.
element.requirements: When multiple parties are present it is required to distinguish the roles performed by each member.

binding.description: The role codes for the care team members.

element.short: Practitioner credential or specialization
element.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.
element.requirements: Need to specify which qualification a provider is delivering the product or service under.

binding.description: Provider professional qualifications.

element.short: Supporting information
element.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.
element.comment: Often there are multiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.
element.requirements: Typically these information codes are required to support the services rendered or the adjudication of the services rendered.

element.short: Information instance identifier
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.
element.requirements: Necessary to maintain the order of the supporting information items and provide a mechanism to link to claim details.

element.short: Classification of the supplied information
element.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.
element.comment: This may contain a category for the local bill type codes.
element.requirements: Required to group or associate information items with common characteristics. For example: admission information or prior treatments.

binding.description: The valuset used for additional information category codes.

element.short: Type of information
element.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes such as the US UB-04 bill type code.
element.requirements: Required to identify the kind of additional information.

binding.description: The valuset used for additional information codes.

element.short: When it occurred
element.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

element.short: Data to be provided
element.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.
element.comment: Could be used to provide references to other resources, document. For example, could contain a PDF in an Attachment of the Police Report for an Accident.
element.requirements: To convey the data content to be provided when the information is more than a simple code or period.

element.short: Explanation for the information
element.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.
element.comment: For example: the reason for the additional stay, or why a tooth is  missing.
element.requirements: Needed when the supporting information has both a date and amount/value and requires explanation.

binding.description: Reason codes for the missing teeth.

element.short: Pertinent diagnosis information
element.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.
element.requirements: Required for the adjudication by provided context for the services and product listed.

element.short: Diagnosis instance identifier
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
element.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.
element.requirements: Necessary to maintain the order of the diagnosis items and provide a mechanism to link to claim details.

element.short: Nature of illness or problem
element.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.
element.requirements: Provides health context for the evaluation of the products and/or services.

binding.description: ICD10 Diagnostic codes.

element.short: Timing or nature of the diagnosis
element.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
element.comment: For example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.
element.requirements: Often required to capture a particular diagnosis, for example: primary or discharge.

binding.description: The type of the diagnosis: admitting, principal, discharge.

element.short: Present on admission
element.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.
element.requirements: Many systems need to understand for adjudication if the diagnosis was present a time of admission.

binding.description: Present on admission.

element.short: Package billing code
element.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.
element.comment: For example, DRG (Diagnosis Related Group) or a bundled billing code. A patient may have a diagnosis of a Myocardio-infarction and a DRG for HeartAttack would assigned. The Claim item (and possible subsequent claims) would refer to the DRG for those line items that were for services related to the heart attack event.
element.requirements: Required to relate the current  diagnosis to a package billing code that is then referenced on the individual claim items which are specific to the health condition covered by the package code.

binding.description: The DRG codes associated with the diagnosis.

element.short: Clinical procedures performed
element.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.
element.requirements: The specific clinical invention are sometimes required to be provided to justify billing a greater than customary amount for a service.

element.short: Procedure instance identifier
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.
element.requirements: Necessary to provide a mechanism to link to claim details.

element.short: Category of Procedure
element.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
element.requirements: Often required to capture a particular diagnosis, for example: primary or discharge.

binding.description: Example procedure type codes.

element.short: When the procedure was performed
element.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.
element.requirements: Required for auditing purposes.

element.short: Specific clinical procedure
element.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.
element.requirements: This identifies the actual clinical procedure.

binding.description: ICD10 Procedure codes.

element.short: Unique device identifier
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
element.requirements: The UDI code allows the insurer to obtain device level information on the product supplied.

element.short: Precedence (primary, secondary, etc.)
element.definition: This indicates the relative order of a series of EOBs related to different coverages for the same suite of services.
element.requirements: Needed to coordinate between multiple EOBs for the same suite of services.

element.short: Patient insurance information
element.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
element.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'Coverage.subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.
element.requirements: At least one insurer is required for a claim to be a claim.

element.short: Coverage to be used for adjudication
element.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
element.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example, a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.
element.requirements: To identify which coverage in the list is being used to adjudicate this claim.

element.short: Insurance information
element.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.
element.requirements: Required to allow the adjudicator to locate the correct policy and history within their information system.

element.short: Prior authorization reference number
element.definition: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.
element.comment: This value is an alphanumeric string that may be provided over the phone, via text, via paper, or within a ClaimResponse resource and is not a FHIR Identifier.
element.requirements: Providers must quote previously issued authorization reference numbers in order to obtain adjudication as previously advised on the Preauthorization.

element.short: Details of the event
element.definition: Details of a accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.
element.requirements: When healthcare products and services are accident related, benefits may be payable under accident provisions of policies, such as automotive, etc before they are payable under normal health insurance.

element.short: When the incident occurred
element.definition: Date of an accident event  related to the products and services contained in the claim.
element.comment: The date of the accident has to precede the dates of the products and services but within a reasonable timeframe.
element.requirements: Required for audit purposes and adjudication.

element.short: The nature of the accident
element.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.
element.requirements: Coverage may be dependant on the type of accident.

binding.description: Type of accident: work place, auto, etc.

element.short: Where the event occurred
element.definition: The physical location of the accident event.
element.requirements: Required for audit purposes and determination of applicable insurance liability.

element.short: Product or service provided
element.definition: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.
element.requirements: The items to be processed for adjudication.

element.short: Item instance identifier
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify item entries.
element.requirements: Necessary to provide a mechanism to link to items from within the claim and within the adjudication details of the ClaimResponse.

element.short: Applicable care team members
element.definition: Care team members related to this service or product.
element.requirements: Need to identify the individuals and their roles in the provision of the product or service.

element.short: Applicable diagnoses
element.definition: Diagnoses applicable for this service or product.
element.requirements: Need to related the product or service to the associated diagnoses.

element.short: Applicable procedures
element.definition: Procedures applicable for this service or product.
element.requirements: Need to provide any listed specific procedures to support the product or service being claimed.

element.short: Applicable exception and supporting information
element.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.
element.requirements: Need to reference the supporting information items that relate directly to this product or service.

element.short: Revenue or cost center code
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.
element.requirements: Needed in the processing of institutional claims.

binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

element.short: Benefit classification
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.
element.requirements: Needed in the processing of institutional claims as this allows the insurer to determine whether a facial X-Ray is for dental, orthopedic, or facial surgery purposes.

binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

element.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.
element.requirements: Necessary to state what was provided or done.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.short: Product or service billing modifiers
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.
element.requirements: To support inclusion of the item for adjudication or to charge an elevated fee.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.short: Program the product or service is provided under
element.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
element.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.
element.requirements: Commonly used in in the identification of publicly provided program focused on population segments or disease classifications.

binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

element.short: Date or dates of service or product delivery
element.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.
element.requirements: Needed to determine whether the  service or product was provided during the term of the insurance coverage.

element.short: Place of service or where product was supplied
element.definition: Where the product or service was provided.
element.requirements: The location can alter whether the item was acceptable for insurance purposes or impact the determination of the benefit amount.

binding.description: Place where the service is rendered.

element.short: Count of products or services
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.
element.requirements: Required when the product or service code does not convey the quantity provided.

element.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.
element.requirements: The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

element.short: Price scaling factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).
element.requirements: When discounts are provided to a patient (example: Senior's discount) then this must be documented for adjudication.

element.short: Total item cost
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: Provides the total amount claimed  for the group (if a grouper) or the line item.

element.short: Unique device identifier
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
element.requirements: The UDI code allows the insurer to obtain device level information on the product supplied.

element.short: Anatomical location
element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
element.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code, allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.
element.requirements: Allows insurer to validate specific procedures.

binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.short: Anatomical sub-location
element.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).
element.requirements: Allows insurer to validate specific procedures.

binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.short: Encounters related to this billed item
element.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.
element.requirements: Used in some jurisdictions to link clinical events to claim items.

element.short: Applicable note numbers
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
element.requirements: Provides a condensed manner for associating human readable descriptive explanations for adjudications on the line item.

element.short: Adjudication details
element.definition: If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.
element.requirements: The adjudication results conveys the insurer's assessment of the item provided in the claim under the terms of the patient's insurance coverage.

element.short: Type of adjudication information
element.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in-aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.
element.requirements: Needed to enable understanding of the context of the other information in the adjudication.

binding.description: The adjudication codes.

element.short: Explanation of adjudication outcome
element.definition: A code supporting the understanding of the adjudication result and explaining variance from expected amount.
element.comment: For example, may indicate that the funds for this benefit type have been exhausted.
element.requirements: To support understanding of variance from adjudication expectations.

binding.description: Adjudication reason codes.

element.short: Monetary amount
element.definition: Monetary amount associated with the category.
element.comment: For example, amount submitted, eligible amount, co-payment, and benefit payable.
element.requirements: Most adjuciation categories convey a monetary amount.

element.short: Non-monitary value
element.definition: A non-monetary value associated with the category. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.
element.comment: For example: eligible percentage or co-payment percentage.
element.requirements: Some adjudication categories convey a percentage or a fixed value.

element.short: Additional items
element.definition: Second-tier of goods and services.

element.short: Product or service provided
element.definition: A claim detail line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.
element.requirements: The items to be processed for adjudication.

element.short: Revenue or cost center code
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.
element.requirements: Needed in the processing of institutional claims.

element.short: Subdetail level adjudication details
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.short: Insurer added line items
element.definition: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.
element.requirements: Insurers may redefine the provided product or service or may package and/or decompose groups of products and services. The addItems allows the insurer to provide their line item list with linkage to the submitted items/details/sub-details. In a preauthorization the insurer may use the addItem structure to provide additional information on authorized products and services.

element.short: Item sequence number
element.definition: Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.
element.requirements: Provides references to the claim items.

element.short: Detail sequence number
element.definition: The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.
element.requirements: Provides references to the claim details within the claim item.

element.short: Subdetail sequence number
element.definition: The sequence number of the sub-details woithin the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.
element.requirements: Provides references to the claim sub-details within the claim detail.

element.short: Authorized providers
element.definition: The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.
element.requirements: Insurer may provide authorization specifically to a restricted set of providers rather than an open authorization.
