element.requirements: Necessary to state what was provided or done.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.short: Service/Product billing modifiers
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.
element.requirements: To support inclusion of the item for adjudication or to charge an elevated fee.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.short: Count of products or services
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.
element.requirements: Required when the product or service code does not convey the quantity provided.

element.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.
element.requirements: The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

element.short: Price scaling factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).
element.requirements: When discounts are provided to a patient (example: Senior's discount) then this must be documented for adjudication.

element.short: Total item cost
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: Provides the total amount claimed  for the group (if a grouper) or the line item.

element.short: Applicable note numbers
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
element.requirements: Provides a condensed manner for associating human readable descriptive explanations for adjudications on the line item.

element.short: Added items adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.short: Insurer added line items
element.definition: The third-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.
element.requirements: Necessary to state what was provided or done.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.short: Service/Product billing modifiers
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.
element.requirements: To support inclusion of the item for adjudication or to charge an elevated fee.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.short: Count of products or services
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.
element.requirements: Required when the product or service code does not convey the quantity provided.

element.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.
element.requirements: The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

element.short: Price scaling factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).
element.requirements: When discounts are provided to a patient (example: Senior's discount) then this must be documented for adjudication.

element.short: Total item cost
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: Provides the total amount claimed  for the group (if a grouper) or the line item.

element.short: Applicable note numbers
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
element.requirements: Provides a condensed manner for associating human readable descriptive explanations for adjudications on the line item.

element.short: Added items adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.short: Header-level adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results which are presented at the header level rather than at the line-item or add-item levels.
element.requirements: Some insurers will receive line-items but provide the adjudication only at a summary or header-level.

element.short: Adjudication totals
element.definition: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.
element.comment: Totals for amounts submitted, co-pays, benefits payable etc.
element.requirements: To provide the requestor with financial totals by category for the adjudication.

element.short: Type of adjudication information
element.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.
element.requirements: Needed to convey the type of total provided.

binding.description: The adjudication codes.

element.short: Financial total for the category
element.definition: Monetary total amount associated with the category.
element.requirements: Needed to convey the total monetary amount.

element.short: Payment Details
element.definition: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.
element.requirements: Needed to convey references to the financial instrument that has been used if payment has been made.

element.short: Partial or complete payment
element.definition: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.
element.requirements: To advise the requestor when the insurer believes all payments to have been completed.

binding.description: The type (partial, complete) of the payment.

element.short: Payment adjustment for non-claim issues
element.definition: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.
element.comment: Insurers will deduct amounts owing from the provider (adjustment), such as a prior overpayment, from the amount owing to the provider (benefits payable) when payment is made to the provider.
element.requirements: To advise the requestor of adjustments applied to the payment.

element.short: Explanation for the variance
element.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.
element.requirements: Needed to clarify the monetary adjustment.

binding.description: Payment Adjustment reason codes.

element.short: Expected date of payment
element.definition: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.
element.requirements: To advise the payee when payment can be expected.

element.short: Payable amount after adjustment
element.definition: Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.
element.requirements: Needed to provide the actual payment amount.

element.short: Business identifier for the payment
element.definition: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.
element.comment: For example: EFT number or check number.
element.requirements: Enable the receiver to reconcile when payment received.

element.short: Printed form identifier
element.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
element.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.
element.requirements: Needed to specify the specific form used for producing output for this response.

binding.description: The forms codes.

element.short: Printed reference or actual form
element.definition: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.
element.comment: Needed to permit insurers to include the actual form.
element.requirements: Needed to include the specific form used for producing output for this response.

element.short: Note concerning adjudication
element.definition: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.
element.requirements: Provides the insurer specific textual explanations associated with the processing.

element.short: Note instance identifier
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify a note entry.
element.requirements: Necessary to provide a mechanism to link from adjudications.

element.short: display | print | printoper
element.definition: The business purpose of the note text.
element.requirements: To convey the expectation for when the text is used.

binding.description: The presentation types of notes.

element.short: Note explanatory text
element.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.
element.requirements: Required to provide human readable explanation.

element.short: Language of the text
element.definition: A code to define the language used in the text of the note.
element.comment: Only required if the language is different from the resource language.
element.requirements: Note text may vary from the resource defined language.

binding.description: A human language.

element.short: When the benefits are applicable
element.definition: The term of the benefits documented in this response.
element.comment: Not applicable when use=claim.
element.requirements: Needed as coverages may be multi-year while benefits tend to be annual therefore a separate expression of the benefit period is needed.

element.short: Balance by Benefit Category
element.definition: Balance by Benefit Category.

element.short: Benefit classification
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.
element.requirements: Needed to convey the category of service or product for which eligibility is sought.

binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

element.short: Excluded from the plan
element.definition: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.
element.requirements: Needed to identify items that are specifically excluded from the coverage.

element.short: Short name for the benefit
element.definition: A short name or tag for the benefit.
element.comment: For example: MED01, or DENT2.
element.requirements: Required to align with other plan names.

element.short: Description of the benefit or services covered
element.definition: A richer description of the benefit or services covered.
element.comment: For example, 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but excludes Ortho, Implants and Cosmetic services'.
element.requirements: Needed for human readable reference.

element.short: In or out of network
element.definition: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.
element.requirements: Needed as in or out of network providers are treated differently under the coverage.

binding.description: Code to classify in or out of network services.

element.short: Individual or family
element.definition: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.
element.requirements: Needed for the understanding of the benefits.

binding.description: Unit covered/serviced - individual or family.

element.short: Annual or lifetime
element.definition: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.
element.requirements: Needed for the understanding of the benefits.

binding.description: Coverage unit - annual, lifetime.

element.short: Benefit Summary
element.definition: Benefits Used to date.

element.short: Benefit classification
element.definition: Classification of benefit being provided.
element.comment: For example: deductible, visits, benefit amount.
element.requirements: Needed to convey the nature of the benefit.

binding.description: Deductable, visits, co-pay, etc.

element.short: Benefits allowed
element.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.
element.requirements: Needed to convey the benefits offered under the coverage.

element.short: Benefits used
element.definition: The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.
element.requirements: Needed to convey the benefits consumed to date.
